This item is now Free.

Compatible with iOS 9 and 10

Bring iOS 11 style screenshotting to iOS 9 and 10.

You can easily share the screenshot by long pressing on the mini image, or start marking on it through the editor by tapping the mini image. If you just want to save the screenshot, you can just ignore the mini image and it'll be automatically dismissed after x seconds, or you can swipe it away.

Disclaimer: ScreenshotXI does not have image stacking or cropping (in editor).

Configure options from Settings

This item is now Free. Fix potential crash due to unnecessary freeing of memory - Fixed edited image not saving when sharing through the image editor
- Added option to save unedited image when sharing through the image editor
- Fixed iPad pro bug where sketches/marks would move to bottom right corner on saving/sharing the image

- Separated right swipe action from left swipe action so now you can save image on left swipe and dismiss (without saving) on right swipe and vice versa (New option to save on right swipe)
- Fixed right dismiss animation (animating to the left) when invoked by long press being started but share sheet isn't displayed
- Added option to copy images to clipboard


- Added option to notify applications that screenshot was taken (before it didn't do this at all)
- Made slight changes to priority to make it more device specific (should still function the same)


- Fix for crashes on iOS 9.0 - 9.3.2 when trying to cancel editing (with save unedited image on cancel enabled) or save editing.


- Added Winterboard Compatibility
- Made the shake animation (invoked when sharing/editing is disable on lockscreen and you attempt to share/edit) slightly smoother


- Fixed saved image having vertically flipped annotations on iOS 9.0 - 9.3.2
- Fixed annotation selection boxes being shown in saved images
- Made it easier to add Cropping (If I ever figure it out) and Image stacking (if someone brings drag and drop to iOS 9 and 10)
